TopicTitle: Tracking Station misaligned in OpenGL mode

Articles.Content:
Kerbal Space Program lags alot when i open it normally. So, to offset the lag, i decided to run KSP in OpenGL mode. This is achieved by adding " -force-opengl" after the target in the shortcut.

It mostly runs without problems but glitches out when i enter the tracking station. The objects and orbits get misaligned and it's almost impossible to scroll around without your head hurting. Here's a gif of the glitch.

GIF Image

Please take note that while i have EVE installed, this bug can be replicated in the stock game as well.

Like this?

All I can suggest is you check your resolution, or don't use OpenGL mode on Windows KSP because it's not supported.

Hi,

I've got the problem on windows with OpenGL and the right screen resolution (1600x900).

I solved it using this command line : KSP.exe -popupwindow -force-opengl

It seems this issue does not show up when in windowed mode. (Popupwindow is a windowed mode without the borders. (Thanks the wiki))

 

See you,
